title: SQL Query: Trains with Speed Greater Than 75
problem_statement:
SQL Query: Trains with Speed Greater Than 75

Problem Description

Write an SQL query to display the train IDs and the names of the trains whose speed is more than 75.

The train IDs should be aliased as 'ID' and the train names should be aliased as 'NAME'.

Examples

Expected Output Columns:

ID | NAME

Constraints

The database schema consists of the following tables:

  • train_details_tbl: Contains details about trains.
    • train_id (INT)
    • train_name (VARCHAR(50))
    • train_type (VARCHAR(5))
    • train_time (VARCHAR(4))
    • train_from (VARCHAR(5))
    • train_to (VARCHAR(5))
    • train_speed (INT)
  • train_type_tbl: Contains types of trains.
    • train_type (VARCHAR(5))
    • type_description (VARCHAR(30))
  • train_stations_tbl: Contains details about stations.
    • station_id (VARCHAR(5))
    • station_name (VARCHAR(30))

The relevant table for this query is train_details_tbl.

title: Employee Salary and Insurance Details Query
problem_statement:
Employee Salary and Insurance Details Query

Problem Description

Write an SQL query to display the following information:

  • The employee category
  • Basic salary paid
  • Insurance provided by the company

Your output should have three columns with the following names:

Employee_Category Basic Insurance

Examples

Example 1:

Input: Database schema containing tables such as EMPLOYEE_INFO and SALARY_INFO, which include columns like EMPLOYEE_CATEGORY, BASIC, and INSURANCE.
Output: A result set with three columns.

Explanation: The SQL query should retrieve the employee category, basic salary, and insurance amount from the database. The resulting columns must be named Employee_Category, Basic, and Insurance respectively.

title: Warehouse of Automobile Factory
problem_statement:
Warehouse of Automobile Factory

Problem Description

You are working in the warehouse of an automobile company and are required to sell automobile parts in the wholesale market.

You are given two arrays -

  • UniqueId[ ] of size N denoting the unique id of each automobile part.
  • Profit[ ] of size N denoting the profit that can be earned by selling each part.

Your task is to return the maximum profit that can be earned by selling the automobile parts in the market.

Note: If two or more consecutive parts in the array UniqueId[ ] have the same id, then only the one amongst them with the maximum profit can be sold.

Input Specification:

input1 : An array of integers denoting the Unique Ids of the automobile parts.

input2 : An array of integers denoting the profit that can be earned per part.

input3 : An integer N denoting the length of the arrays.

Output Specification:

Return an integer denoting the maximum total profit that can be earned by selling automobile parts.

Examples

Example 1:

Input: input1 = [4,6,3,3,4]
input2 = [-1,10,10,15,-5]
input3 = 5
Output: 25

Explanation: We can sell the 2nd and 4th items and earn a total profit of 10 + 15 = 25. This is the maximum possible profit that we can earn. Note that we cannot sell both the 3rd and 4th items as they have the same unique id. Hence, 25 will be returned as the output.

Example 2:

Input: input1 = [1,2,1]
input2 = [10,20,30]
input3 = 3
Output: 60

Explanation: We can sell all the 3 items and earn a total profit of 10 + 20 + 30 = 60. This is the maximum possible profit that we can earn. Note that we can sell the 1st and 3rd items having the same UniqueId as they are not consecutive. Hence, 60 will be returned as the output.
